mdRecord.dcterms:title: J. G. Melson House, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Griffin, Walter Burley (American architect and city planner, 1876-1937, active in the United States, Australia, and India) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Melson house can be considered one of the half dozen most significant houses of the Prairie movement, and it is certainly Griffin's most impressive realized domestic design. The house was designed for J. G. Melson, one of the developers of Rock Crest-Rock Glen. The house is situated right on the edge of a limestone outcropping overlooking the valley. -- http://sah-archipedia.org/detail%2Fcontent%2Fentries%2FIA-01-NO228.xml?q=%28type%3Ahouses%29%20AND%20style%3A%22Prairie%20School%22 [work]
